docs.snippet: A Kentucky Republican, shunned even by his own party for posting images on Facebook depicting President Barack Obama as a monkey, held a defiant press conference during which he declined to apologize to those offended or suspend his campaign for t...

headline.print_headline: Candidate Defies GOP, Refuses to Drop Out for Offensive Post

docs.snippet: The Museum of Modern Art has enlisted scholars and artists to take a deeper look at Sander’s ambitious effort to catalog the German people.

headline.main: A New Look at August Sander’s ‘People of the Twentieth Century’

docs.snippet: My colleagues Wesley Morris and Jenna Wortham came into the kitchen for a talk and some turkey, a bird we should be eating way more often.

A desperate Pakistani family anxiously awaiting a U.S. visa for their ailing little girl is running out of time: Maria is just six years old but a rare genetic disease has left her frail body wracked with pain and stunted her growth.

headline.print_headline: Desperate Pakistan Family Awaits US Visa for 6-Year-Old Girl
headline.main: Desperate Pakistan Family Awaits US Visa for 6-Year-Old Girl

docs.snippet: The United States remains the "closest friend" of the Philippines but Manila wants to break away from a "mindset of dependency and subservience" and forge closer ties with other nations, the Philippine foreign minister said on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Philippines Says to Keep U.S. Ties but Will Not Be Subservient
headline.main: Philippines Says to Keep U.S. Ties but Will Not Be Subservient

docs.snippet: Technology has made cultivating relationships easier, but also shallower.

docs.snippet: Here is a look at five cases: Some of the people involved apologized. One denied being responsible. And another said his actions had been misconstrued.
